item.title: Report E-2024050323
item.description:
Report E-2024050323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: DURANGO
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG MERCHANT GAS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 217500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Merchant Gas Group, LLC unit was traveling eastbound on Highway 160 near Durango, Colorado when it drifted off the roadway and rolled over. The trailer was compromised as a result of the rollover and approximately 35,740 pounds of refrigerated natural gas was released into the atmosphere. The local hazmat agency handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024050331
item.description:
Report E-2024050331

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-15
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN2922 Super Concentrated Toi-De-Fresh Lavatory Deodorant release from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 6’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a puncture caused by a load shift. The damaged pail, impacted shrink wrap, and debris were all containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
